Topics.Title: Causes of Heat Exhaustion
Topics.Content: Heat exhaustion is caused by high temperatures and humidity.

Topics.Title: Signs of Heat Stroke
Topics.Content: If someone shows signs of heat stroke, you should provide emergency treatment immediately.

Topics.Title: Symptoms of Heat Exhaustion
Topics.Content: The symptoms of heat exhaustion include heavy sweating, dizziness, and fatigue.

Topics.Title: First Aid for Heat Stroke
Topics.Content: First aid steps for heat stroke include calling 911 and cooling down the person.

Topics.Title: Common Causes of Fires
Topics.Content: Common causes of fires include smoking materials and electrical fires.

Topics.Title: Overloaded Electrical Outlets
Topics.Content: Overloaded electrical outlets can lead to fires due to overloaded circuits.

Topics.Title: Fire Safety for Space Heaters
Topics.Content: A fire safety measure for space heaters is to not leave them unattended.

Topics.Title: Storage of Flammable Liquids
Topics.Content: Flammable liquids should be stored properly to prevent combustion.

Topics.Title: Reporting Fire Hazards
Topics.Content: If you observe a fire hazard, you should report it to a supervisor.

Topics.Title: Housekeeping for Fire Prevention
Topics.Content: Housekeeping is important for fire prevention to keep exits clear.

Topics.Title: Keeping Sprinkler Heads Clear
Topics.Content: Sprinkler heads should be kept clear with an 18-inch space around them.

Topics.Title: Proper Waste Material Disposal
Topics.Content: Waste materials should never be piled in corridors or stairwells.

Topics.Title: When to Close Fire Doors
Topics.Content: Fire doors should always be closed to prevent the spread of fire.

Topics.Title: Avoiding Multi-Outlet Taps
Topics.Content: Multi-outlet taps should be avoided to prevent overloaded circuits.

Topics.Title: Safe Alternative to Extension Cords
Topics.Content: A safe alternative to extension cords is to use a surge protector.

Topics.Title: Regular Checks on Electrical Equipment
Topics.Content: You should regularly inspect wiring on electrical equipment.

Topics.Title: Precautions for Using Electrical Appliances
Topics.Content: A precaution for using electrical appliances is to unplug them after use.

Topics.Title: Function of Smoke Detectors
Topics.Content: The function of a smoke detector is to detect smoke.

Topics.Title: How Heat Detectors Work
Topics.Content: Heat detectors work by sensing high temperatures.

Topics.Title: Triggering Sprinklers
Topics.Content: Sprinklers are triggered by heat activation in case of fire.

Topics.Title: Planning Evacuation Routes
Topics.Content: It is important to plan two evacuation routes for alternate exits.

Topics.Title: Avoiding Elevators During a Fire
Topics.Content: You should avoid elevators during a fire because of the risk of power loss.

Topics.Title: Location of Fire Alarm Pull Stations
Topics.Content: Fire alarm pull stations are usually located by exits.

Topics.Title: Using a Fire Extinguisher
Topics.Content: Before using a fire extinguisher, you should identify a safe path.

Topics.Title: P.A.S.S. Technique
Topics.Content: The P in P.A.S.S. stands for Pull pin, A stands for Aim low, S stands for Squeeze handle, and the second S stands for Sweep base.

Topics.Title: Re-Ignition of Fire
Topics.Content: If the fire re-ignites after using an extinguisher, you should repeat the steps.

Topics.Title: When to Evacuate Immediately
Topics.Content: You should evacuate immediately during a fire if there is any doubt about your safety.
